body.name: Yesterday's Tides
body.description: In 1942, Evie Farrow is used to life on Ocracoke Island, where every day is the same—until the German U-boats haunting their waters begin to wreak havoc. And when special agent Sterling Bertrand is washed ashore at Evie's inn, her life is turned upside down. While Sterling's injuries keep him inn-bound for weeks, making him even more anxious about the man he's tracking, he becomes increasingly intrigued by Evie, who seems to be hiding secrets of her own.Decades earlier, in 1914, Englishman Remington Culbreth arrives at the Ocracoke Inn for the summer, but he doesn't count on falling in love with Louisa Adair, the innkeeper's daughter. When war breaks out in Europe, and their relationship is put in jeopardy, will their love survive?As Evie and Sterling work to track down an elusive German agent, they unravel mysteries that go back a generation. The ripples from the Great War are still rocking their lives, and it seems yesterday's tides may sweep them all into danger again today.Bestselling and award-winning author Roseanna M. White whisks you away to two periods fraught with peril in this sweeping and romantic dual-time tale. Read more

productInformation.value: #24,431 in Audible Books & Originals (See Top 100 in Audible Books & Originals) #44 in 20th Century Historical Romance (Audible Books & Originals) #55 in Christian Historical Fiction (Audible Books & Originals) #103 in Christian Romance (Audible Books & Originals)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I just couldn't put this book down. It covered the first World War and the second World War through two generations. I took the suggestion from my sister and started with the 'yesterdays' all the way to the end and then came back and finished up with all the 'todays'. It read better that way. Very much worth the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I just love this author. I love how her stories incorporate love stories, God and a bit of mystery and suspense. So so good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Intriguing historical novel
reviews.reviewText: "Very rarely is history written by people doing what's expected of them. If we want to make a difference-well, we do it by defying the norms, don't we?"I've always enjoyed this author's work and Yesterday's Tides was no exception. It goes back and forth between two periods in history and the perspective of Louisa and Evie. It was very interesting getting the perspectives of women in the same family and same place during both WWI and WWII. Roseanna tackled some controversial topics with diplomacy. There was so much family drama and romance, and history while also dealing with a mystery. Some of the characters were absolutely horrible, though very well written. I loved the descriptions of Ocracoke Island. It just sounded like an ideal place to live, when it's not surrounded by German u-boats anyway. It had a very big surprise twist that absolutely shocked me. Really, I enjoyed every moment of reading this novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: White does it again! Wow, just wow. She crafted such an excellent, riveting story. Complex but beautifully interwoven and deeply emotional. I think this is my new favorite of her books. I’ve read almost every series of hers and I don’t want to give anything away, but White is so, so good at tying in past (and future) characters from her other novels into the current one. It’s the best. It’s like visiting old friends. This an incredible work of historical romance fiction.Also, thank you Roseanna, for writing so sweetly of Ocracoke and the Outer Banks. I was born and raised there and I think you did a great job representing it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing, must read!
reviews.reviewText: Roseanna is an amazing author! Her stories are intriguing, filled with good moral characters and exciting story plots. I love how she includes God and history and romance :D so well written! I highly recommend! A good inspiring and clean read! And it was fun to tie into other books with Room 40!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gripping in its powerful gentle strength
reviews.reviewText: Even the title captured me before opening to the first page, but this story, so beautifully written, evoked intense feelings of family and friendship and community, and the love and loss they bring, I could not put it down. I loved that it entwined the codes and code breakers of the earlier books I'd read. But no matter how close people can be, there are the secrets one can hold so closely, they bring mystery yet by prayer and trusting faith God makes all things work together for good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast service, quality product.
reviews.reviewText: Product arrived quickly, in fantastic condition. Author is a favorite. Can't wait to read the book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this intriguing story that flip flopped between WWI and WWII. This author is an expert storyteller! I loved the intricacies and challenges all woven together, however sometimes I would get lost especially if I had gotten busy and put the book down for a couple days. There were a lot of characters to keep straight. Overall an excellent story though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Roseanna M White has written another fabulous book. This hardback edition is definitely beautiful and feels luxurious. It starts off somewhat slowly, but amazing how she ties so many threads together. Would make a great gift.
